com.mousebird.maply

Class RenderTarget

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.RenderTarget

  • public class RenderTarget
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a render target (other than the screen)
    Individual objects can ask to be drawn somewhere other than the screen. This is how we do that. A render target is just a link between a render every frame and a MaplyTexture. To get at the actual image you use the MaplyTexture. At the moment a render target can only draw the full screen, possibly at a lower resolution.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean blend
      If set, anything rendered to this render target will blend with what's there.
      boolean clearEveryFrame
      If set, we'll clear the target textures every frame before rendering to it.
      int color
      Clear the render target to this color every frame.
      long renderTargetID
      The internal ID for the render target.
      MaplyTexture texture
      The texture we'll draw into.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Field Detail

      • texture

        public MaplyTexture texture
        The texture we'll draw into.
        This is the texture we'll draw into. Use createTexture to set it up.

      • renderTargetID

        public long renderTargetID
        The internal ID for the render target. Don't mess with this.

      • clearEveryFrame

        public boolean clearEveryFrame
        If set, we'll clear the target textures every frame before rendering to it. If not set, we won't clear the render target texture between frames. True by default.

      • color

        public int color
        Clear the render target to this color every frame. Default is clear black.

      • blend

        public boolean blend
        If set, anything rendered to this render target will blend with what's there. If not set, what's rendered will replace what was there before. This is the way it normally works for screen rendering. Set to false by default.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RenderTarget

        public RenderTarget()
